quotes.quote: When you're the victim of the behavior, it's black and white; when you're the perpetrator, there are a million shades of gray.
We are not a victim of our emotions or thoughts. We can understand our triggers and use them as tools to help us respond more objectively.
There are no victims, only volunteers.
We're all victims of our own hubris at times.
Victims make excuses. Leaders deliver results.
The victim of mind-manipulation does not know that he is a victim. To him, the walls of his prison are invisible, and he believes himself to be free
You are a victim only when you have decided to play the part.
Where victims see adversity, extreme achievers see opportunity.
The worst kind of victim was the kind that was aware of nothing.
The victim to too severe a law is considered as a martyr rather than a criminal.
We're all victims of what life deals out. It's how we handle it that's important.
We were not the victims of ancestor worship. We had the benefits of a fresh start.
You can't play the role of a victim all your life without becoming one in the end.
We become victims of the great disease of technological society - meaninglessness.
We are not victims of the world we see, we are victims of the way we see the world.
You are not a helpless victim of your own thoughts, but rather a master of your own mind.
What hurts the victim most is not the cruelty of the oppressor, but the silence of the bystander.
The real victim of bigotry is the white man who hides his weakness under his myth of superiority.
You become the victim of the past, and your tormentor today is your self left over from yesterday.
We are all victims of the violence that animals suffer... their liberation is also our liberation.
You are not a victim of your circumstance.Stay determine to endure hard times. No situation is permanent.
Victims of oppression & injustice don't need our spasm of passion....they need our legs & lungs of endurance.
One victim lives in tragedy, another victim stops to stare, and still another walks on by pretending not to see
Don't become a victim of yourself. Forget about the thief waiting in the alley; what about the thief in your mind?
Once trapped in the belief that you are a victim, you surrender your birthright to compete for the prizes of life.
The victims of crime have been transformed into a group oppressively burdened by a system designed to protect them.
It is true that a victim who fights back may suffer for it, but one who does not almost certainly will suffer for it.
As victims of hurt, we frequently don't bring up what ails us, because so many wounds look absurd in the light of day.
We are all both victims and victimizers. Just as everyone suffers, no one is innocent of causing suffering themselves.
We don't have to be victims of our past, that we can let go of our bitterness, and that all of us can achieve greatness.
